communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P032248-051525
communications.communication:
Dear Rose  Terse, Thank you for your interest in public records of Tukwila Police Department.  Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on May 15, 2025 and given the reference number P032248-051525 for tracking purposes. The City of Tukwila is in receipt of your public records request received by the Tukwila Police Department on May 15, 2025, regarding records associated with: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ftukwila-police-department-5736%252Fflock-safety-search-audits-network-sharing-and-general-order-tukwila-police-department-186568%252F%253Femail%253Dpdrecords%252540tukwilawa.gov&url_auth_token=AABB8Pcwq_lGbpRlok39-nzQwLA%3A1uFlee%3Ap3Q6N1cCvvBYPSIBQDfLZh8P__wdg2mHIT2gha-uOzM Your request will be forwarded to the relevant Tukwila Police Department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. Department staff members are searching City systems to identify documents responsive to the request. Due to the nature of the request, records may be provided in installments, with the availability of the first installment on or before 6/6/2025. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at 206-433-1808. 
 Respectfully, Records Unit Tukwila Police Department 206-433-1808 The City of Opportunity, the Community of Choice ** NOTICE OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE:  This e-mail account is public domain.  Any correspondence from or to this e-mail account is a public record.  Accordingly, this e-mail, in whole or in part, may be subject to disclosure pursuant to RCW 42.56, regardless of any claim of confidentiality or privilege asserted by an external party.**

3. A list of network share settings that include: 
3a. Flock networks shared with me 
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please note there are black boxes (redactions) on various pages of the responsive documents. The black box may be small or large, depending on the size of the redaction. There may be multiple redactions on a page. Within the redaction is a white code, which will look something along the lines of “Redacted Text [1a].” This code designates the statutory exemption being applied to the document. If there is only one code on the page, but there are numerous redactions, that one statutory exemption applies to all the redactions. 
Provided with these responsive documents is a key to the codes. This key identifies the statutory bases for the exemption as well as a brief explanation for why the exemption applies. As you review these responsive documents, you will be able to refer to the key below to identify the exemption and its application. 
You should now be able to retrieve any responsive records via the Tukwila PD electronic Record Center.
The records are best viewed on a desktop or laptop computer. The records may not be accessible from a mobile device. Review of the records for installments must be made within 30 days of notification of availability or the request can be closed. 
We estimate the next installment to this request will be available on or before 8/1/2025.  If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly.  Conversely, if the department encounters a need to extend our time estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date. 
Regards, 
Rebecca

To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system.

  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C231564-070625.

  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request.

title: Richard Bast

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard Bast
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents on, about, mentioning, or concerning the private investigator Richard Lee Bast (October 18, 1932 - March 21, 2001), Social Security No. 578-40-9899 and the companies he founded in the greater Washington, DC area known as Redex Corporation (1970s) and International Investigations, Inc. (1980-90s). 

I understand that the file may be rather large. If it exceeds 5,000 pages, I wish to speak to a negotiator to help reduce the scope of responsive records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: FOIA request 1411473(Redex Corp)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Redex Corp. The FBI has located approximately 2948 pages that are potentially responsive to your request. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process. A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, I would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  We could potentially narrow your request by date, or if you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-1695, Monday - Friday between the hours of 7:00am and 3:00pm Eastern time.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

title: USGS communications

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USGS communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".

This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.

Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Reynolds

communications.subject: FOIA: DOI-2025-003235 – Acknowledgment of your FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Reynolds:

On January 24, 2025, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) FOIA office received your FOIA request and assigned it control number DOI-2025-03235.  Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request.  You request the following information:

All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".

This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.

Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.

On January 21, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from Mr. Dave Levinthal, assigned control number DOI-2025-003169, for the following information:

Request disclosure from the Office of the Director, Office of Communications and Publishing, U.S. Board on Geographic Names, Office of the Alaska Regional Director, and Office of the Southeast Regional Director.

1. Any records and documents — including but not limited to emails, memoranda, notes, electronic chat messages and calendar items — that include any of the following words/names in either uppercase or lowercase form on changing the name:

• Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America
• Denali to Mt. McKinley or Mount McKinley

2. The same types of records on purchase of Greenland

The date range for this request is January 1, 2025, to the present.

On January 21, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from Bloomberg News, assigned control number DOI-2025-003184, for the following information:

Request disclosure from the US Geological Survey's U.S. Board on Geographic Names

1) All records, which includes, but is not limited to emails (including attachments), text messages, internal studies, final reports, directives, memos, letters, on changing the name of the Gulf of Mexico the "Gulf of America."

2)The same types of records on changing the name of Denali to "Mount McKinley."

3) Emails (including attachments) of U.S. Board on Geographic Names staff that mention "Gulf of America"

4) Emails of U.S. Board on Geographic Names staff that mention Denali or Mount McKinley.

The timeframe for this request is January 1, 2025 to the present.

Additionally, on January 22, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from WIRED, assigned control number DOI-2025-003203, for the following information:

Records dated from December 1, 2024 through the time this request is processed relating to Donald Trump's desire to rename the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America and the related executive order and in the possession of Michael Tischler, Shellie Zahniser, or Chris Hammond of the U.S. Geological Survey.  The term “records” includes emails (with attachments) but also refers to other documents and items, such as text messages; invitations, communications, and chats from meeting applications such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams; encrypted apps such as Signal, WhatsApp, and others; phone records; calendar entries; recordings of virtual or in-person meetings; and communications on collaboration platforms such as Slack. It omits news articles and messages from listservs that distribute them unless accompanied by substantial commentary from one of the above-named people or an interlocutor.

Your request falls into the Complex processing track.  We have gathered materials as potentially responsive to DOI-2025-003169, DOI-2025-003184, and DOI-2025-003203.  However, we have not yet completed a review of these records.  We will provide records in rolling releases to you in conjunction with releases issue for DOI-2025-003169, DOI-2025-003184, and DOI-2025-003203.

We classified you as an “other use” requester.  As such, we may charge you for some of our search and duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our review costs; you are also entitled to up to 2 hours of search time and 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free.  See 43 C.F.R. § 2.39.  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected.  See 43 C.F.R. § 2.49(a)(1).  We do not anticipate any fees related to your request.

The 2007 FOIA amendments created the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) to offer mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your right to pursue litigation.  You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS
College Park, Maryland  20740-6001
Telephone:     (202) 741-5770
Fax:                 (202) 741-5769
Toll-free:         1-877-684-6448
E-mail:            ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Web:                https://www.archives.gov/ogis

Please note that using OGIS services does not affect the timing of filing an appeal with the Department’s FOIA & Privacy Act Appeals Officer.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison, who you may also seek dispute resolution services from, is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters.

If you have any questions, please contact me by email at jcearley@usgs.gov<mailto:jcearley@usgs.gov>.




Sincerely,

Judy Cearley

Government Information Specialist

U.S. Geological Survey

Department of the Interior

(650) 329-4035 (office)

foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>

communications.subject: FOIA: DOI-USGS-2025-003235 - Delayed Processing Notification
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Reynolds,

We are writing regarding your FOIA request, DOI-USGS-2025-003235, to provide delayed processing notification.

As yet, we have been unable to make a determination on your request, but we do intend to comply with your request.  Your request falls into the Complex processing track, there are 11 requests pending ahead of yours in our processing queue.

At this time, we are actively working on your request.  We have completed the preliminary review of the potentially responsive records.  We are preparing an interim release to you and have sent the records for an internal review.  We anticipate providing the interim release to you by March 17, 2025.

Due to the nature of the remaining records, consultations have been sent to other federal agencies, and we are waiting for their responses.  Once we receive responses from the other federal agencies, the records will still need to go through legal review by the Department of the Interior, Office of the Solicitor, Division of General Law.

We apologize for this delay.  You may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently assigned track or move the request into a different track (which may have the effect of reducing the cost of processing your request and having it processed more quickly).  You also may agree to an alternative time period for processing by communicating with us, our FOIA Requester Center, or the FOIA Public Liaison.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Requester Centers and FOIA Public Liaison is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters.

You may also seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS).  If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS
College Park, Maryland  20740-6001
Telephone:      (202) 741-5770
Toll-free:         1-877-684-6448
E-mail:            ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Web:                https://ogis.archives.gov<https://ogis.archives.gov/>

You may file an appeal with the Department’s FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer regarding this delay.  If you choose to appeal this delay, you may do so anytime between now and the date we make our determination on the FOIA request.  Appeals arriving or delivered after 5 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, will be deemed received on the next workday.

Your appeal must be made in writing.  You may submit your appeal and accompanying materials to the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer by mail, courier service, fax, or email.  All communications concerning your appeal should be clearly marked with the words: "FREEDOM OF INFORMATION APPEAL."  You must also include with your appeal copies of all correspondence between you and USGS concerning your FOIA request, including your original FOIA request and USGS's response.  Failure to include with your appeal all correspondence between you and USGS will result in the Department's rejection of your appeal, unless the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer determines (in the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer’s sole discretion) that good cause exists to accept the defective appeal.

Please include your name and daytime telephone number (or the name and telephone number of an appropriate contact), email address and fax number (if available) in case the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer needs additional information or clarification of your appeal.

DOI FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office Contact Information
Department of the Interior
Office of the Solicitor
Attn: FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office
1849 C Street, N.W.
MS-6556 MIB
Washington, DC  20240
Telephone:      (202) 208-5339
Fax:                 (202) 208-6677
Email:              FOIA.Appeals@sol.doi.gov<https://mail.google.com/mail/?view=cm&fs=1&tf=1&to=FOIA.Appeals@sol.doi.gov>

For more information on FOIA Administrative Appeals, you may review the Department's FOIA regulations at 43 C.F.R. Part 2, Subpart H<https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-43/part-2#subpart-H>.<http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.8>

We regret the delay and appreciate your consideration.  If you have any questions, please contact me by email at foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>.

Thank you for your patience while we continue processing your request.




Sincerely,

Judy Cearley

Government Information Specialist

U.S. Geological Survey

Department of the Interior

(650) 329-4035 (office)

foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R011574-061125
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock News: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of District of Columbia. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 6/11/2025 and given the reference number R011574-061125 for tracking purposes. 
In all future correspondence regarding this request, please reference request number R011574-061125. You can monitor the progress of your request in the " My Records Center". (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcOhwwBPGHifqhO6OQOqgdwS-2FNpGxLbyeC-2FXmT4cIxy2lH6u_B-2FefHXMqqa3-2BMeO3armGlK19P1MtxST266YUwqBM8MOm-2FXhmDarTSxE4Is9KhDiwE40eBzdhG2MLN-2Bk-2B8iL7Q44Tm7XKhivihC6EX6MMTNS5cupEyvS5S8uYBWzMuBCNVAJXg-2Fl-2B0QHK8S3WtJXIXd65z3J9gHcjR1jM7NdMGdkhvMJYSq2bzdrTaCPkS2qCWUStx-2BV1Z4RSQol4XF5UAIcacGnwFAe5fxkLtBwFLnUS38nQXf-2Bm315r5V0s0Cfo7F-2FTwbo9omtbi8pSAvAVVyZOkf2MW74BnmMnglvDjxCve4NDTg6Vo-2BX0kVZ1HB1piQmlQwMUCNv1GWpT7VF-2BTQ0nfDG0JJOkeZ99qrQygMeUYQa6WJnYGaDH81bUODDJ) 
 
The District of Columbia is required to respond to your FOIA request within fifteen (15) business days of its receipt.  See D.C. Official Code § 2-532(c)(2011).  However, under certain circumstances, D.C. Official Code § 2-532(d)(2011) authorizes the District to extend, by ten (10) additional days, the deadline by which it must respond to a FOIA request.  One of the circumstances provided by that statute is a case in which the District needs additional time to search for, collect and examine voluminous amounts of records and/or consult with an additional D.C. agency. 
For any questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA office directly. Find the list of agency Open Government and FOIA contact information by visiting FOIA Contact Information. For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIA Reference Number available when you contact the FOIA office. 
Regards, 
District of Columbia

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Andrew Ma
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 186573
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Dear Mr. Ma,

This is the response of the DC Department of Corrections (DOC) to your below FOIA request, seeking “a list of currently employed mental health professionals” serving the inmates that are in DOC’s custody. Please be advised that a contractor, Unity Health Care, Inc., provides health care services to DOC inmates. The information you are requesting relates to the contractor’s personnel matter. It is not the kind of information that DOC creates and maintains. Under the FOIA, an agency’s search obligation is limited to records or information the agency has created and/or maintained. Finally, DOC did not create and did not find the requested list.

If you consider this response a denial of your FOIA request, please be advised that, under D.C. Official Code § 2-537 and 1 DCMR 412, you may appeal to the Mayor or to the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.

If you elect to appeal to the Mayor, your appeal must be in writing and contain “Freedom of Information Act Appeal” or “FOIA Appeal” in the subject line of the letter as well as on the outside of the envelope.  The appeal must include (1) a copy of the original request, (2) a copy of this letter, (3) a statement of the circumstances, reasons, and or arguments advanced in support of disclosure, and (4) a daytime telephone number, and e-mail and/or U.S. Mail address at which you can be reached.  The appeal must be emailed to foia.appeals@dc.gov<mailto:foia.appeals@dc.gov> or mailed to the Mayor’s Office of Legal Counsel (MOLC) at 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 407, Washington, D.C. 20004. Further, a copy of all appeal materials must be forwarded to me.

Failure to follow these administrative steps will result in delay in the processing and commencement of a response to your appeal to the Mayor.

Sincerely,

Oluwasegun Obebe
Records, Information & Privacy Officer
DC Department of Corrections
Office of the General Counsel
3924 Minnesota Ave, NE
Washington, DC 20019
(202) 671-2055 (O)
(202) 538-2389 (C)
(202) 671-1705 (F)
Segun.obebe@dc.gov<mailto:Segun.obebe@dc.gov>
www.doc.dc.gov<http://www.doc.dc.gov/>

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Obebe,

Thank you again for your response and for clarifying that mental health services are provided by Unity Health Care.

In light of that, I’d like to respectfully follow up with two related requests:
	1.	Chaplaincy Contacts: Could the DC Department of Corrections provide a list of currently employed or contracted chaplains or staff involved in spiritual or faith-based programming within DOC-operated facilities? Specifically, I’m looking for:
	•	Full names
	•	Job titles
	•	Assigned facility
	•	Government-issued work email (or phone number if email is not available)
	2.	Unity Health Care Liaison: I understand that DOC does not maintain personnel records for Unity Health Care. That said, would it be possible to share contact information for a point of contact at Unity Health Care — ideally someone in a supervisory or coordination role — who oversees behavioral or mental health programming in DOC facilities? If you do not have this directly on file, any guidance or direction would be appreciated.

To provide some context: I represent a grassroots meditation group that offers free, trauma-informed mindfulness programs to support the well-being of incarcerated individuals. We’re hoping to connect with relevant stakeholders — including chaplains and behavioral health coordinators — to understand whether our offerings might be supportive within existing wellness or rehabilitative programming.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Bonney Lake Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Bonney Lake Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Request number: 20250612-RT1

We received your request for FLOCK records. We have located responsive records for items 1, 3a and 3b. The scope of records for item 2 would be very large and creating a record that we do not have. Pursuant to per WAC 44-14-04003(6)<https://app.leg.wa.gov/wac/default.aspx?cite=44-14-04003>, we are not obligated to create a record in order to fulfill this request:

(6) No duty to create records. An agency is not obligated to create a new record to satisfy a records request. However, sometimes it is easier for an agency to create a record responsive to the request rather than collecting and making available voluminous records that contain small pieces of the information sought by the requestor or find itself in a controversy about whether the request requires the creation of a new record. The decision to create a new record is left to the discretion of the agency. With respect to databases, for example, there is not always a simple dichotomy between producing an existing record and creating a new record. In addition, an agency may decide to provide a customized service and if so, assess a customized service charge for the actual costs of staff technology expertise needed to prepare data compilations, or when such customized access services are not used by the agency for other business purposes.

However, if you wish to receive the records responsive to items 1, 3a and 3b there is a fee of $3.50. I have attached the worksheet for how the fee was calculated based off the fact that necessary redactions will be applied to some documents. Please call the main line below during normal business hours Mon-Fri 8:30-4:30) to pay your fee. We will be closed tomorrow, 6/19.

If we do not receive payment by 6/27/25 your request will be considered abandoned and closed.

Thank you,

[cid:image002.png@01DBE033.AC1569C0]
Miranda Jeter
Records Clerk
Bonney Lake Police Department
Office Phone (253) 863 - 2218 opt. 4
Fax  (253) 863 - 2661
18421 Veterans Memorial Drive E. Bonney Lake, WA 98391

communications.subject: Public Records Act Response – Closing Letter
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse,

Request number: 20250612-RT1

This letter is to inform you I have enclosed all records in response to your public records request which you made on 6/12/25 for a copy of “Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
Records related to the department's Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of Decemebr 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the ageny.
2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should inlude data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is avialble within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization's Flock network by any agency in the Flock system.
3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I'm sharing
Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.”

Please note that some records have either been withheld in their entirety or redacted based on a statutory exemption. For any records that may be denied, you do have the right to seek internal review of any denials of requests per RCW 42.56.520(4).<https://app.leg.wa.gov/RCW/default.aspx?cite=42.56.520> The enclosed exemption log provides information about the records withheld and/or redacted and the basis for withholding or redaction.

Your records request is considered fulfilled and, therefore, is now closed. The one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started.

This concludes the City of Bonney Lake’s response to your public disclosure request; your request is now closed. If you believe that the City of Bonney Lake has other records that are responsive to this request, or if you have questions or difficulty viewing the records provided, please contact me within 14 days.

Please contact the office at (253) 863-2218 opt 4, fax (253) 863-2661 or by email pdrecords@cobl.us<mailto:pdrecords@cobl.us> if you need further assistance.

Thank you,

title: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with EBSCO relating to the licensing of Education Research;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with EBSCO for Education Research database licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Education Research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with smhc.

title: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 to 61.884), I respectfully request the following public records:

⸻

1. Law Enforcement Certifications (Statewide):
	•	A list of all individuals certified as peace officers in the Commonwealth of Kentucky as of the date of this request.
	•	For each officer: full name, date of birth (or year of birth), employing agency, certification status (active/inactive/expired), certification type (e.g., POPS), issue date, and expiration date.
	•	Please include any notes regarding pre-certification, conditional certification, or decertification.

2. Brady/Giglio Disclosure List (Commonwealth of Kentucky):
	•	A current list of law enforcement officers or public officials who are known to be subject to Brady or Giglio disclosure obligations due to credibility, misconduct, or dishonesty issues.
	•	Please include any officers flagged or designated by prosecutors, the Kentucky State Police, the Kentucky Law Enforcement Council, or the Office of the Attorney General.
	•	If no centralized list exists, please provide any policy or guidance that governs Brady/Giglio reporting within the Commonwealth.

3. Oaths of Office and Official Bonds (Graves County):
	•	Certified copies of the oaths of office and official bonds for all currently serving public officials in Graves County, including:
	•	All deputies, command staff, and elected officials in the Graves County Sheriff’s Office
	•	All Mayfield Police Department officers
	•	All county-level judges and prosecutors
	•	The Graves County Clerk, County Attorney, and all magistrates or county commissioners

This request is submitted in good faith for public accountability and transparency and is specifically intended to confirm the legal authority, certification, and ethical standing of public officials acting within Graves County and the Commonwealth.

I am a resident of Kentucky, and this request is made in accordance with 21-ORD-193 and KRS 61.872(1).

I prefer digital delivery of responsive documents to: pager06@gmail.com. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me in advance.

Thank you for your time and attention to this request.

Sincerely,
Paige Kathleen Allen
P.O. Box 322
Mayfield, KY 42066
Email: pager06@gmail.com
Phone: (270) 205-1773

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paige Allen

title: Claims of Interest (2025)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Claims of Interest (2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of everyone that filed intent to claim interest for the 2025 Wayne County tax auction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Mondry

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: BTC Held By US Marshals Service
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of bitcoin held by the US Marshals Service. 

As an independent journalist, I ask that all fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lola Leetz

communications.subject: JMD FOIA Request 137393 Acknowledgement (Intranet Quorum IMA00175683)
communications.communication:
May 21, 2025  Ms. Lola Leetz  DEPT MR 182298 
MuckRock News 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115-4506  Re: The amount of bitcoin held by the U.S. Marshals Service  Assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER: 137393  Dear Ms. Leetz:  This is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Act request dated 3/2/2025 and received in this office on 5/21/2025 in which you requested records concerning the subject identified above.  Your request was sent to JMD by the US Marshals Service as a misdirected request. The identifying tracking number was 2025-USMS-001026.  For your information, the Justice Management Division assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited. Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track. Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month whereas complex requests necessarily take longer. At this time, your request has been assigned to the Complex track. Please note that as a general matter, records in the Department are decentralized and our response will only cover information originating with or relating to JMD. If you are seeking information originating with or relating to other components of the Department, please make a FOIA request directly to those components.  If you have a question about the status of your FOIA request, you may contact this office by emailing JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov or by calling 202-616-0253 during regular business hours (Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Eastern Time, excluding federal holidays).  Please refer to your assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER listed above whenever you contact the Department regarding this request.  Sincerely,  Daniel Wagner FOIA Contact Justice Management Division

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Raleigh Police Department)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Raleigh Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Archie Smith

title: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting complete military service records for United States Army veteran Thomas J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served in the U.S. Army with estimated service from approximately mid-1950s through 1970s. As his grandson conducting family genealogical research, I am seeking his military personnel file and service documentation.

Records requested:

- Official Military Personnel File (OMPF)
- Service record and assignment history
- Military photographs and portraits
- Awards, decorations, and commendations
- Training records and military education
- Unit assignments and duty stations
- Discharge documentation


FAMILY BACKGROUND: My grandfather Tommy, served as an Army equipment/inventory specialist and I was told that he was stationed at a major base in Washington State. I was named after my grandfather (my middle name is Thomas), reflecting the close relationship we had before his passing when I was 11 years old. I have no surviving immediate family contact and possess no military service documentation or even photographs of his career.

GENEALOGICAL PURPOSE: This request serves family heritage preservation and military service legacy documentation.

Fee waiver requested for family genealogical research and military heritage preservation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Kashuba:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email referral to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on June 9, 2025.  Your request
concerns the *military service records for United States Army veteran
Thomas J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served in the U.S. Army.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally
becomes an archival record 62 years after the date of discharge.

At www.archives.gov/foia <http://www.archives.gov/foia%20> we provide
information about FOIA.  On our home page, www.archives.gov, you can learn
about the resources that we offer to the public, and access our online
catalog.

Sincerely,

<https://www.archives.gov/>

  Ashley Bryan

  Government Information Specialist

  Operational FOIA and Access Division

  College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001

  301-837-3642

   <https://www.archives.gov/foia>   <foia@nara.gov>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/contacts>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/electronic-reading-room>
<https://www.archives.gov/ogis/resources>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Bryan, 

Thank your expeditious and gracious response. My son and I are looking forward to memorializing grandpa Tommy's legacy in both the US Army and Police Career through our records acquisition efforts. 

I would like to bring to your attention that my submission here on Muckrock was directed at the NPRC when I made the request. There is a possibility that the email address was somehow mis-indexed on Muckrock or possibly mis-routed somewhere along the way. I just wanted to bring this to your attention and anyone else that it may benefit. 

Once again please accept my gratitude for your fast and professional response, 

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: C-0005921493 Request for Military Records
communications.communication:
Hi Justin,

Unfortunately the request that you submitted did not list a contact phone
number so I was not able to reach you.  Your request also did not contain a
mailing address, so I was not able to mail a response letter.  The only
contact information listed in your request is this unusual email address.

I'm sending the only information available based on the extremely limited
information that you provided.  This information is Archival and is
releasable to anyone.

The date of birth does not match but it was only off by one day.  You did
not provide the veteran's Social Security Number, Place of Birth, Date of
Death, Service Number or specific dates of service.

Generally our website is a better option for submitting requests because it
guides you on the information necessary to locate a record-  The link is
listed below for your reference.

https://www.archives.gov/veterans

Thank you,
-- 
Melinda Vaupel
Expert Archives Technician 1D
National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, MO  63138

Office: (314) 801-0977

Email: Melinda.vaupel@nara.gov

title: Police disciplinary files (Lewis County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Lewis County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

communications.subject: Welcome to the Lewis County Records Center!

 351 NW North Street, Chehalis, WA 98532 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference # P015147-071325

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request all records—paper or electronic—created
or received by FBI Headquarters, the Tampa Field Office, or the Los Angeles
Field Office from 1 Jan 1990 to the present that reference:

 • Church of Scientology International (CSI)
 • Religious Technology Center (RTC)
 • Flag Service Organization (FSO)
 • Flag Ship Service Organization / motor vessel “Freewinds” (FSSO)
 • Sea Organization (“Sea Org”)
 • David Miscavige, Gavin Potter, Valeska Paris, Gawain Baxter,
   Victoria Locke, Chrissie Carnell Bixler, or Danny Masterson

Requested subject matter

   – allegations of sexual assault or child sexual abuse  
   – human trafficking or forced labor (18 U.S.C. §§ 1589–1591)  
   – retaliation, “Fair Game,” obstruction of justice, or witness tampering  
   – use or enforcement of arbitration agreements to suppress reports

Record types

Please search main and cross-reference indices, “Zero Files,” Sentinel,
ACS, ELSUR indices, and any predecessor systems for:

   ● FD-302 witness interviews, lead sheets, case summaries  
   ● Physical-evidence or electronic-surveillance logs  
   ● Referral/declination letters to USAOs or DOJ divisions  
   ● Internal legal memoranda analyzing First-Amendment issues  
   ● Closed investigative files (no pending law-enforcement purpose)

If portions are exempt, please release all reasonably segregable non-exempt
material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chia

title: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Complete 2024-2025 evaluation document of the Superintendent of Schools, including all individual evaluation sections used in the assessment. Include all written commentary included within the document. 
- Scoring or rating by each board member, including any per-section breakdowns.
- Any tabulation documents or score compilations showing how the final average score of 3.81 was calculated. 
- All supporting documentation related to the evaluation process, such as evaluation rubrics or templates used. 
- Any memos, drafts, or other written communications to or from board members regarding the evaluation or evaluation process. 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

communications.subject: FOIA Response – Superintendent Evaluation Records (PCI IN-03-576 / MuckRock Request No. 188060)
communications.communication:
To:            Sam Bellford via 188060-94688149@requests.muckrock.com

Dear Mr. Bellford,

This email responds to your Freedom of Information Act request dated June
16, 2025, regarding the 2024–2025 evaluation of the Superintendent of
Schools.

Response to Requested Items
·       Final Evaluation Document: The complete 2024–2025 Superintendent
Evaluation document, including individual evaluation sections and written
commentary, was publicly posted on the Thomaston Board of Education website
as part of the June 9, 2025 Regular Meeting agenda.
·       Scoring or Ratings by Board Members: The Board of Education does
not maintain individual scoring or per-section breakdowns by member. Only
the final, composite evaluation document is maintained.
·       Tabulation or Score Compilation: The rubric and calculation method
used to determine the average score of 3.81 are included in Board Policy
2400, which is posted publicly on the district’s website.
·       Supporting Documentation: No additional templates, forms, or tools
were used beyond what is available within Policy 2400. No further records
exist.
·       Memos or Communications: The district maintains no memos, drafts,
or written communications to or from Board of Education members concerning
the 2024–2025 Superintendent evaluation or its process. Therefore, there
are no responsive records for this item.
·       Format and Fees: As all responsive records are already available
online, no documents are being attached and no fees are assessed for this
response.

This response complies with the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (CGS
§1-200 et seq.). No records have been created or modified for the purpose
of responding to this request.

If you have any further questions, you may contact me directly.

Sincerely,

*Francine Coss*
Superintendent of Schools

*Thomaston Public Schools Mission Statement:*

In a partnership of family, school and community, our mission is to
*educate*, *challenge* and *inspire* each individual to excel and become a
contributing member of society.
*Thomaston Public Schools*
185 Branch Road
Thomaston, CT 06787
Phone: 860-283-3053
Fax: 860-283-3096
www.thomastonschools.org
@ThomastonBOE <https://twitter.com/ThomastonBOE>



*The information contained in this communication may be confidential or
legally privileged and is intended only for the recipient(s) named above.
If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby
notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this
communication or its contents is strictly prohibited.  If you have received
this communication in error, immediately advise the sender and delete the
original and any copies from your computer system.*

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation
communications.communication:
Superintendent Coss,

Thank you for your response to my FOIA request.

As noted, Board Policy 2400 includes Form 2, which outlines the rubric used to evaluate the superintendent. This form includes 30 questions across several categories and appears to be the basis for the 3.81 aggregate score posted on the district’s website in the June meeting minutes. 

To clarify, can you please confirm whether Form 2 was completed by members of the Board of Education as part of the 2024–2025 evaluation process? If so, I respectfully request copies—draft or final—of any completed versions of this form in their entirety. The rubric responses and section-level evaluations offer important context for understanding the final composite score. If individual board member evaluations were not retained, can you confirm if a final version with the averages by question is available? 

Thank you again for your time and attention to this request.

Best regards,
Sam Bellford

title: Virginia DOC transgender policies

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Ileana Garnand.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
Thank you for your request for public records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.). Please be advised that pursuant to § 2.2-3704(A) of the Code of Virginia, “all public records shall be open to citizens of the Commonwealth, representatives of newspapers and magazines with circulation in the Commonwealth, and representatives of radio and television stations broadcasting in or into the Commonwealth during the regular office hours of the custodian of such records...The custodian may require the requester to provide his name and legal address.”

Therefore, unless you are associated with the media, please provide a legal Virginia address to show your residency. Please respond with this information to move forward with your FOIA request. The statutory timeline for the Virginia Department of Correction’s response is tolled until you respond with a legal Virginia address.

Sincerely,

Anne-Cabrié Forsythe
FOIA Officer
(804) 963-2953

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC transgender policies

Thank you for your continued support with this request. Please see the attached proof of residency.

[ID Redacted]

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Nash,

Thank you for your request for records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.) received on June 25th. Please be advised that it is administratively impossible to provide the requested records or determine whether they are available within the five working days required by FOIA because of the scope of your request. Therefore, we are invoking § 2.2-3704(B)(4) of the Code of Virginia to provide us seven additional working days to respond to your request.
Best,

Riley O'Brien
Records Administrator
804-584-3420

title: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University Of Texas At Tyler)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University Of Texas At Tyler)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a survey of events planned or proposed by recognized or registered student organizations (or individual students or faculty members). I am seeking copies of calendar entries for events that were held or proposed. I am not seeking a search of records held by students or student organizations. I am only seeking information held by the university administration (for example, in an Event Management System, which may be helpful in providing a list of past events and proposed future events). 

If this request is unclear or if I could clarify it in any way, please don't hesitate to ask.

I request:

1. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member during the final two weeks of each term during 2023, 2024, and Winter/Spring 2025. If your institution's academic calendar does not identify a final date of a given term, please use the final day of exams for the term as the final day of the term.

2. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m., between January 31, 2023 and July 1, 2025.

3. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be held after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m. This request is limited to events that are proposed to be held between July 1, 2025 and July 1, 2026. 

4. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be during the final two weeks of a term in the Fall 2025, Winter 2025-2026, or Spring 2026 semesters/terms. Please us the same means of calculating "final two weeks" as in (1), above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Federal government Rule 11 letters (Securities and Exchange Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Federal government Rule 11 letters (Securities and Exchange Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. In any litigation before a federal district court on behalf of the United States or any agency, department, official, or employee thereof, any letter sent by your attorneys containing any of the following terms: 
a. "Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 11"
b. "Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, Rule 11"
c. "FRCP 11"
d. "Fed. R. Civ. P. 11"
e. "Fed. R. Civ. P., Rule 11"

2. Any policies, manuals, or guidance (not including guidance specific to a particular case) concerning pursuit of Rule 11 sanctions.

This request is limited to correspondence sent (or policies, manuals, or guidance utilized) on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Bowling

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District
communications.communication:
-----BY EMAIL ONLY-----

To:          Mr. Joshua Bowling
MuckRock News
              189420-25968973@requests.muckrock.com

Fr:          Melissa Howden
                Records Custodian 13th Judicial District Attorney of New Mexico

Re:         IPRA Request re Brady Giglio

Dear Mr. Bowling,

I, the undersigned am the Records Custodian for the 13th Judicial District Attorney of New Mexico. I received your request forwarded to me on 7/10/2025 for:


- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.


The 13th Judicial District does not maintain any lists, datasets or spread sheets detailing potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. During the current administration of District Attorney Barbara Romo, we have had one Giglio disclosure letter and case re: former Officer Robert Turney in our Cibola County District. Included here is a document fragment detailing the underlying case. The allegation of misconduct came from a discovery from the district court; therefore, we don’t have specific additional records other than the attached letters to:

  *   The letter the Sheriff of Cibola County asked our deputy to draft and send.
  *   The spreadsheet detailing the cases for which we had to submit a disclosure letter.
  *   A copy of the disclosure letter.( Each letter heading was corrected for each case otherwise the body of the letter was the same, the letter attached is a sample).

title: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Ninth Judicial District

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Ninth Judicial District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Bowling

title: Safety National Casualty Corporation / Sedgwick Claims Management Services Regulatory Action (Illinois Department Of Insurance)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Safety National Casualty Corporation / Sedgwick Claims Management Services Regulatory Action (Illinois Department Of Insurance)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

An excel spreadsheet of the complaints filed against Safety National Casualty Corporation or Sedgwick Claims Management Services and a digital copy of any accusations or verified reports of bad faith or deceptive business practices since January 1st 2020; in additional any contracts or agreements with them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Fecteau

communications.subject: 25-FO-0749 RE: [External] Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Safety National Casualty Corporation / Sedgwick Claims Management Services Regulatory Action (Illinois Department Of Insurance)
communications.communication:

Thank you for reaching out to our office.  As we work to process your request, we have identified three parts to your request:

  *   Part 2: A digital copy of any accusations or verified reports of bad faith or deceptive business practices since January 1st 2020

Regarding Part 3, could you please clarify this request?  Are you seeking contracts or agreements between the Illinois Department of Insurance and the two companies you have identified?

Please respond to this email by July 2, 2025.

All the best,

Renee
