title: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February  14, 2023)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February  14, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Chapter 610 of the Missouri Revised Statutes, also known as the Missouri Sunshine Law, primarily deals with the public's right to access information from public governmental bodies in Missouri.

I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to the arrest of Matthew Leibach on or about February  14, 2023 at approximately 4:48 AM, by the St. Louis County Police.

Specifically, I am requesting:
All body-worn camera footage recorded by any St. Louis County Police Department personnel during the detention, investigation, or arrest of Matthew Leibach also footage of the vehicle chase that resulted in Matthew Leibach crashing the vehicle at Ohio Avenue and Broadway Street in St. Louis City.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Martin

communications.subject: [Invoice Created] St. Louis County public records request #25-7072
communications.communication:
St. Louis County ************************************************************************ An invoice has been created for record request #25-7072. Please pay by visiting Request #25-7072. We have researched your request and have a total of 4 hours and 26 minutes of body cam footage. This video footage includes 11 officer(s) that responded to the incident. The estimated fee for producing the requested records is as follows: * Video for All Officers: 4 hours and 46 minutes @ hourly rate 36.86 = $175.69. The total to process your request is $175.69. In accordance with Section 610.026.1(1) RSMo, the police department is requiring you to pay the estimated cost for the records you are seeking, prior to the records being reproduced for you. These fees are calculated on the best estimate of the actual cost of the research time to assemble and produce these records. Upon receipt of payment of the estimated cost, the records which are responsive to your request and are open records will be provided to you without undue delay. If for some reason I am unable to produce the open records within three business days after receipt of payment, I will provide an estimate on how long it will take. We accept cash, credit cards (excluding American Express), checks/ money orders (payable to the Treasurer of St. Louis County), or online payment through this system. By making an online payment on this request invoice, you agree to pay 2.9% of the payment amount plus $0.30. This fee goes to the payment gateway vendor, so St. Louis County receives only the invoiced amount. Please reference Next Request number (25-7072) on payment. Payment can be sent to the following address: St. Louis County Police Department Record Room Attn: Shannon Morgan 7900 Forsyth Blvd. Clayton, MO 63105 If payment is not received within 30 days, I will consider this request closed and you will then need to resubmit a new request. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? title: Public Records Request - Sebastian

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sebastian Police Department,


I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://www.sebastiandaily.com/crime/sebastian-woman-45-arrested-for-dui-kicking-cops-53901/



Exact address of incident: Sebastian Boulevard (CR-512)

Exact date of incident: 7th of August, 2023 around 11 p.m

Names of parties involved: Jennifer Brown



I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.


I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.


Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.



Best regards,

George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.subject: FW: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian
communications.communication:
Please accept this correspondence as acknowledgment for your Public Records Request. Please note we are working on providing the requested documentation as quickly and efficiently as possible, consistent with the provisions of Chapter 119.071, Florida Statutes.







Thank You,

Records Department

Sebastian Police Department

1201 Main Street

Sebastian,  FL  32958

(772) 589-5233

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Firstly, please direct any future requests to pdpublicrecordrequest@cityofsebastian.org<mailto:pdpublicrecordrequest@cityofsebastian.org> .


This request has been completed.  Please see the attached cost sheet for the redactions prior to mailing a hard copy of the redacted BWC videos.

The following exemptions were applied:

  *   Florida Statute 119.071(2)(I) – BWC within a medical facility

Thank you,

Dakota Helgeson
Evidence Technician
Sebastian Police Department
1201 Main St.
Sebastian, FL 32958
772-589-5233 Ext: 8527

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian

Thank you.

Thank you.
